result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony James Leske

records.addlTxt:
2:10 PM Defendant Anthony James Leske in court.  Attorney Stephen Robert Zuber in court for Anthony James Leske.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case. Defendant will stipulate to revocation in 20CF320, state does not oppose another status conference in 21CF522 and 22CF110. Attorney Zuber agrees. Defendant will obtain domestic violence treatment. 
Motion to terminate granted, Judgment granted.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:21 AM Defendant Anthony James Leske in court appearing by video.  Attorney Stephen Robert Zuber appeared by video for Anthony James Leske.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 20CF320, 22CF110, 21TR3218, 21CF522, and 22TR3219. In 21CF522, Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests status. Parties jointly request status in all cases with later date. State indicates that lab results will not be returned until October. Would like to go ahead with motion to terminate in 20CF320. Attorney Zuber and defendant oppose termination, ask it to trail with other matters to try to reach global resolution. State asks that judgment be entered in the case and to set matter for sentencing at the time of the other statuses. Court notes concerns over continuing motion to terminate, would allow a few week continuance. Parties set sentencing in 20CF320. All other trailing matters set for status.
Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Anthony James Leske in court.  Attorney Stephen Robert Zuber in court for Anthony James Leske.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. 
Attorney Zuber makes oral motion on no contacts.  Victim is in court, requesting, as is the defendant, that no contact be amended to no violent or abusive contact and that the defendant be permitted at the residence.  
State-victim is present and invites to them to address the court.  Opposes modification of bond. Believes extremely high probability of great bodily harm or death. Concerns that there would be witness tampering. Defendant poses a clear and present danger to the victim. Severely concerned about the victim.

Victim Kaitlyn Christiansen-she and children would love to see him at home, just love to have the no contact lifted.

Court reviews file; conditions ordered by Judge Thimm.

Court believes conditions are necessary, denies motion for modification of bail.

Request that 21CF522 and 21 TR3218. 3219 be removed from 4/25/22 and re set for 7/22/22 at 11 along with this case
Arraignment scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: No contact with witnesses: Jason LaTour, Chase Nelson, Destiny Smith and Kyle Christiansen named in complaint. No contact with Victim #1 or their address. One time property retrieval with law enforcement to the address.

3:18 PM Defendant Anthony James Leske appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ellen Craker appears via video. Attorney Craker received complaint waives reading and pleads not guilty to remaining charges. State requests $10,000 cash bail with conditions of no contact with Victim #1 or their address. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Not contact with witnesses-Jason LaTour, Chase Nelson, Destiny Smith and Kyle Christiansen named in complaint. Defendant has several failures to appear. Defendant has pending cases in Douglas County one signature bond and one with $500 cash bail. Defendant has criminal charges from 2015 and 2017 in Wisconsin. Attorney Craker asks that alleged victim have contact and no violent or abusive contact with Victim. Attorney Craker notes one of the WI cases is a DJOC. Asks for one time with LE to address to retrieve belongings if no contact with address is ordered. Defendant could post $3,000 -$3,500 and has been living in the area for 10 years. Court orders $3,500 cash bail with conditions of no contact with witnesses: Jason LaTour, Chase Nelson, Destiny Smith and Kyle Christiansen named in complaint. No contact with Victim #1 or their address. One time property retrieval with law enforcement to the address.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
